title: Jared Adam
text:
In search of causes; getting bogged down by correlations.


A brief introduction of me.




My name is Jared Seneca Adam and I currently reside in Montana, where I spend most of my time running around the woods and clambering up rocks, all while looking at, and for, plants and arthropods. At present, I am a PhD student at Montana State University, where I study plant-arthropod interactions. I am deeply interested in population dynamics and the use modeling to understand the role of plant traits in response to abiotic and biotic stress. Additionally, I am fascinated by causation and am working on broadening my understanding of cause and effect, the role of cause and effect in Ecology, the age-old debate of Frequentsit vs.Â Bayesian, how we can use both of these pools of statistical thinking to produce appropriate models, and how we can train Ecologists both maximum likelihood and probability-based modeling to ensure our science is sound as we work to answer harder questions in an ever-changing environment.
